citation.case_name: Atlantic Coast Line Railroad Co. v. Brotherhood of Railway Trainmen

html:
385 U.S. 20

87 S.Ct. 226

17 L.Ed.2d 20

ATLANTIC COAST LINE R. CO. et al.
v.
BROTHERHOOD OF RAILWAY TRAINMEN et al.

No. 220.

Supreme Court of the United States

October 24, 1966

Paul A. Porter and Dennis G. Lyons (Abe Krash and Daniel A. Bezneck, on the briefs), for petitioners.

Neal Rutledge and Allan Milledge (Lester P. Schoene, on the brief), for respondents.

On Writ of Certiorari to the United States Court of Appeals for the Fifth Circuit.

PER CURIAM.

1

The judgment is affirmed by an equally divided Court.

2

Mr. Justice FORTAS took no part in the consideration or decision of this case.
html_lawbox:
385 U.S. 20 (1966)

ATLANTIC COAST LINE RAILROAD CO. ET. AL.
v.
BROTHERHOOD OF RAILWAY TRAINMEN ET AL.

No. 220.

Supreme Court of United States.

Argued October 10, 1966.
Decided October 24, 1966.
CERTIORARI TO THE UNITED STATES COURT OF APPEALS FOR THE FIFTH CIRCUIT.

Paul A. Porter and Dennis G. Lyons argued the cause for petitioners. With them on the briefs were Abe Krash and Daniel A. Rezneck.

Neal Rutledge and Allan Milledge argued the cause for respondents. With them on the brief was Lester P. Schoene.

PER CURIAM.

The judgment is affirmed by an equally divided Court.

MR. JUSTICE FORTAS took no part in the consideration or decision of this case.
